Mayor and City Council
======================

![DSC_6717-3 (3)](https://www.lakejackson-tx.gov/ImageRepository/Document?documentID=9397 "DSC_6717-3 (3)")

Pictured standing from left to right: City Attorney Sherri Russell, Councilmember Jon "J.B." Baker, Councilmember Leonard Schooler, Councilmember Vinay Singhania, Councilmember Buster L. Buell, III, City Secretary Sally Villarreal. Seated from left to right: Mayor Pro-Tem Rhonda Seth, Mayor Gerald Roznovsky, and City Manager Modesto Mundo.

It is the mission of the City of Lake Jackson to be a leader among cities and in the region at large in delivering outstanding quality services to all citizens through innovative and efficient use of resources

### Members of Council:

|  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
| [Gerald Roznovsky, Mayor](mailto:g.roznovksy@lakejacksontx.gov) Term Expires: May 2026 | [Rhonda Seth, Position 3](mailto:r.seth@lakejacksontx.gov) Term Expires:  May 2027 | [Ralph L. Buell, III, Position 4](mailto:r.buell@lakejacksontx.gov) Term Expires: May 2026 |
| [Vinay Singhania, Position 2](mailto:v.singhania@lakejacksontx.gov) Term Expires: May 2026 | [Leonard Schooler, Position 1](mailto:l.schooler@lakejacksontx.gov) Term Expires: May 2027 | [Jon "J.B." Baker, Position 5](mailto:j.baker@lakejacksontx.gov)Term Expires: May 2027 |

### Agendas/Minutes/Packets

[Agendas and Minutes](https://www.lakejackson-tx.gov/AgendaCenter/City-Council-15 "Agendas/Minutes") / [Council Packets](https://www.lakejackson-tx.gov/DocumentCenter/Index/85 "Council Packets") / [Public Hearings](https://www.lakejackson-tx.gov/399/Public-Notices "Public Hearings")  
Overview  
The City of Lake Jackson operates under the Council/Manager form of government. The City Council consists of a mayor and five council members, who serve two-year staggered terms and are elected on an at-large basis. You may contact any of your elected officials. They are not assigned to a particular area of Lake Jackson. Citizens may view a copy of the [Strategic Plans](https://www.lakejackson-tx.gov/DocumentCenter/Index/32 "Strategic Plans") to grasp a better understanding of the goals and objectives set forth by the City Council.
